shorts.title: GAMEFACE: LFC Players to Watch in Week 11
shorts.title_distilled: GAMEFACE: LFC Players to Watch in Week 11.
shorts.description: LUCAS EVANS Lackawanna Trail OL-DL An all-state tackle, he was a poised and physical leader up front for the Lions, who racked up 501 yards rushing last week in a 40-14 win over Riverside. DYLAN LOOMIS Lakeland, OL-DL Made a position change from tight end and developed into one of the top offensive linemen in LFC. He also had five tackles with two for loss in a win over Mid Valley last week. WILL McPARTLAND Scranton Prep, QB-DB Since his return from an ACL injury, he has been one of the dynamic players in the LFC. He has 712 yards […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, October 31, 2025
shorts.description: Lackawanna County Third annual veterans Mass: Divine Mercy Parish will honor veterans with a special veterans program Nov. 9 at 5 p.m. at 320 Davis St. in Scranton. The event will begin with a Mass at 5 p.m. during which a blessing will be offered for all veterans in attendance. The Rev. Bert Kozen from Immaculate Heart of Mary Parish in Dushore, a native of Williamsport, will serve as guest celebrant and homilist. He served in the Army National Guard in Iraq, Bosnia and Kosovo, eventually achieving full colonel, and state chaplain for the Pa. National Guard. A reception and […]

He served in the Army National Guard in Iraq, Bosnia and Kosovo, eventually achieving full colonel, and state chaplain for the Pa. National Guard. A reception and […]

shorts.title: PIAA GIRLS TENNIS: Evans, Hanumali set for singles; Prep, Abington Heights doubles in action
shorts.title_distilled: PIAA GIRLS TENNIS: Evans, Hanumali set for singles; Prep, Abington Heights doubles in action.
shorts.description: Players from the Lackawanna League begin their quests for medals at the PIAA Singles and Doubles Tennis Championships this weekend. Montrose junior Cara Evans and Abington Heights senior Sona Hanumali will compete in the Class 2A and Class 3A singles tournaments. The Scranton Prep doubles team of Lily Lengyel and Emma Cuck looks to add another honor to their impressive Class 2A careers, and Abington Heights’ doubles team of Amishi Amit and Sammy Rosenstein will be in action in Class 3A, as well, at the Hershey Racquet Club. Hanumali takes the court at 8 a.m. The District 2 Class 3A […]

shorts.title: Lynnette’s Twirlettes visit Salem, Mass.
shorts.description: Twirlers from Lynnette’s Twirlerettes’ Forest City, Lake Ariel and Carbondale divisions twirled for the ninth time in the city of Salem, Massachusetts’ Haunted Happenings Parade on Oct. 2, which officially kicked off their Halloween season. Over 15,000 spectators lined the streets of Salem for this annual parade. Stars from the original movie “Hocus Pocus” served as grand marshals. More than 85 family members and friends took the trip to Salem supporting the twirlers, who also toured the city first by trolley and then on their own, experiencing ghost and witch walks, among seeing many other attractions of Salem’s witch trial […]

shorts.title: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, Dunmore at Riverside
shorts.title_distilled: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, Dunmore at Riverside.
shorts.description: The last time Dunmore and Riverside clashed, it came down to the final play. That was just the start of the season. This battle will send the winner to a District 2 Class 2A championship game. On Friday, third-seeded Dunmore (7-3) plays No. 2 Riverside (8-2) in a semifinal game at Riverside Veterans Memorial Stadium at 7 p.m. It is a rematch of the Week 1 classic that Riverside won 17-14 in overtime on a Santino D’Amico field goal after Dunmore turned the ball over in its possession. “The team, since that loss, really focused because that was a great […]
